SENT.plain: Four Rh-positive patients with severe aplastic anemia received equine anti-lymphocyte globulin
Each developed a positive direct antiglobulin test
Anti-D was identified in eluates prepared from the patients' sensitized red cells
The administered lot of anti-lymphocyte globulin was found to contain anti-D
Red cell sensitization due to passively acquired Rh antibodies can result from the administration of anti-lymphocyte globulin
